com.percussion.content
Class PSConversionResults

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.content.PSConversionResults

public class PSConversionResults
extends Object

Encapsulates the results from converting content using the PSContentConverter

Constructor Summary
PSConversionResults(PSPurgableTempFile resultFile, String fileType, String encoding)
          Construct this class from its member data
 
Method Summary
 Reader getContent()
          Get a reader to the content of the conversion results.
 String getEncoding()
          Get the encoding used to write the results.
 String getFileType()
          Get the type of file that was converted.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

PSConversionResults

public PSConversionResults(PSPurgableTempFile resultFile,
                           String fileType,
                           String encoding)
Construct this class from its member data

Parameters:
resultFile - The temp file containing the results, may not be null and must reference a valid file. Will be deleted after the reader returned by getContent() is closed.
fileType - The type of file that was converted, never null or empty. This is the description of the file type returned by the conversion implementation.
encoding - The encoding used to write the file, never null or empty. Either the IANA or Java encoding name may be supplied.
Method Detail

getContent

public Reader getContent()
                  throws UnsupportedEncodingException,
                         FileNotFoundException
Get a reader to the content of the conversion results.

Returns:
The reader, never null. Caller assumes ownership of the reader and is responsible for closing it.
Throws:
FileNotFoundException - if the file supplied during construction does not exist or cannot be opened.
UnsupportedEncodingException - if the encoding supplied during construction is not supported.

getFileType

public String getFileType()
Get the type of file that was converted.

Returns:
The file type supplied during construction, never null or empty.

getEncoding

public String getEncoding()
Get the encoding used to write the results.

Returns:
The encoding supplied during construction, never null or empty.
